pull.title: Move CTxDestination from script/script to script/standard
pull.body: This removes CTxDestination (which is really about standard template scripts) from the core script dependency.

events.body:
Great, this is basically what we discussed in #4698 and #4755.
Sorry again about trying to randomly moving it down to key and base58 when it really had to move up. I knew I didn't like it in script/script.
Untested ACK

+1 to @laanwj's suggestion, I like GetScriptForDestination() more than SetScriptToDestination().
Maybe GetScriptFromDestination(), but that's bike shedding.

events.message: Move CTxDestination from script/script to script/standard

events.body:
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4899_0be990ba34110184c8a5a2c04094311dab5cd84c/ for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.

issue.title: Script destinations break-out
issue.body:
More work on reducing script dependencies. I'm not sure if this is wanted yet, if not I'm fine with holding off.

This allows CScript to work without knowledge of CTxDestination. Most of the dependencies on key.h are dropped, and a boost dependency is dropped as well. Next obvious steps would be to do the same for CPubKey, move SetMultisig() out, etc. This seemed like a good stopping point before continuing with those.

comments.body:
Just a random idea: maybe instead of `void SetScriptTo...(...)`,  we could change this API to `CScript GetScriptFor...(...)`. These functions clear out the script and replace it with something else, so unless I'm missing something, there no need to pass in an initial script.

ie, instead of having

```
Script script; SetScriptToDestination(script, dest);
```

everywhere, this would allow

```
Script script = GetScriptForDestination(dest);
```

(I know in the case of SetScriptToDestination there is a return value, but if I saw correctly we ignore it everywhere...)

Edit: (doesn't need to be in this pull, of course)
